#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Sharjah ( emirate )
#Text=Sharjah ( إمارة الشارقةّ ) is the third largest of the seven emirates of the United Arab Emirates .
#Text=Cities
#Text=- the capital of the emirate , UAE 's third largest city
#Text=Al Dhaid
#Text=Kalba
#Text=- a seaside town along the Gulf of Oman
#Text=- a seaside resort near northern border of the UAE with Oman 's Musandam peninsula
#Text=Understand
#Text=Sharjah emirate has borders with Dubai , Umm al Quwain and Fujairah while the emirate of Ajman forms an enclave within Sharjah .
#Text=It is the only emirates to have a coastline on both the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman .

#Text=This is by virtue of the emirate being made up of a main part ( where the capital city Sharjah is ) that is located along the Persian Gulf , and the exclaves of Kalba , Khor Fakkan , and Dibba Al Hisn which are scattered along the Gulf of Oman coast .
#Text=Sharjah also controls the Nahwa enclave , which is located within the Omani exclave of Madha , which in turn is surrounded by Sharjah territory near the Gulf of Oman coast .
#Text=Because of its proximity to Dubai and the lower cost of living in Sharjah , many people live in Sharjah and work in Dubai .
#Text=This causes daily traffic jams at rush hours .
#Text=Talk
#Text=As in the rest of the UAE , Arabic is the official language , with most residents actually speaking other languages entirely - particularly Hindi and Urdu .
#Text=English is widely spoken in shops , souqs , and hotels .
#Text=Get in
#Text=For visa requirements to visit Sharjah , see the United Arab Emirates page .
#Text=Sharjah International Airport ( SHJ )
#Text=Sharjah International Airport is around 15 kilometres from Sharjah city .
#Text=It is the home of the low cost carrier Air Arabia which has connections with various Middle East and Indian Subcontinent cities .
#Text=Getting to/from the airport :
#Text=There is a shuttle bus connecting the airport with Sharjah centre ( Rolla ) running every 30 min ( Dhs . 5 ) .
#Text=Public bus route 111 ( Dhs . 10 ) runs hourly from the airport via Al Qusais Bus station to the Metro 's Rashidiya station in Dubai .
#Text=Dubai International Airport ( DXB )
#Text=Dubai International Airport , in the neighbouring emirate of Dubai , has many more international connections and will be the more popular gateway to Sharjah .
#Text=Getting to/from the airport :
#Text=To go to Dubai International Airport by taxi will set you back at around Dhs . 100 .
#Text=You can travel by public bus to or from Dubai International Airport by using Dubai 's local bus service and the inter-Emirate bus service .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Bus travel to Dubai is possible via an inter-emirate bus service run by the Government of Dubai Road and Transport Authority .
#Text=Most buses leave from the Al Jubail ( Al Jabal ) bus station next to the Sharjah Fish market and the Sharjah Fruit and Vegetable market , nearby to the Central Souk .
#Text=A bus from Sharjah to Dubai can take about 1 h and costs Dhs . 5 .
#Text=Timetables can be found at the RTA website .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=Taxis can travel from Dubai to Sharjah and vice versa without any restrictions .
#Text=Get around

#Text=There is no public transport in Sharjah , which means that visitors will need to have their own wheels or rely on taxis , which have historically been unmetered , and although some of these remain , but several new companies operating metered taxis have become operational .
#Text=They are similar in quality to Dubai 's taxi fleet .
#Text=Taxi drivers , although mostly courteous , have the tendency to refuse passengers if the time of travel coincides with rush hour traffic .
#Text=It is advisable to plan your travel well , allowing for traffic jams which could take 90 min to get out of .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Sharjah is known as a " dry emirate " so means the sale or possession of alcohol within Sharjah is almost entirely forbidden .
#Text=Exceptions :
#Text=Sharjah Wanderers Club , .
#Text=Sports club with pool , gym , hockey team but also a British bar with traditional British food .
#Text=It serves spirits , wine , bitter , lager and stout on the premises .
#Text=Members and their guests only .
#Text=Alcohol is available at the duty-free and business class lounges of Sharjah International Airport .
#Text=If you have an personal alcohol license , you may bring in alcohol from other emirates and consume it at home .
#Text=Also , it is legal to transport alcohol through Sharjah if your final destination permits it ( such as from Dubai to Fujairah ) .
#Text=Some police may not be familiar with this rule though .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Generally speaking , Sharjah is a very safe place .
#Text=Western women may get a few stares as they are fairly rare in Sharjah , but it is a safe place to walk around even at night .
